schema:name: Number of additional tree pests and diseases becoming established in England, 2000-2009 to 2013-2022

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:description: Annual statistical report providing the key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Forestry Commission showing progress towards the organisationâ€™s key aims. This includes the six headline indicators of Forest Services and Forestry England respectively and around a further 25 indicators. Each indicator is for England as a whole at national level. This is an Official Statistics publication. The report itself is accompanied by tables of supporting data providing the indicator statistics.
schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Forestry Commission Key Performance Indicators: Report for 2022-23
schema:isBasedOn.schema:text: Annual report on the full suite of Forestry Commission key performance indicators (KPIs) for both Forest Services and Forestry England.

schema:distribution.name: Forestry Commission Key Performance Indicators: Report for 2022-23
Forestry Commission Key Performance Indicators: Report for 2022-23 Supporting data

schema:variableMeasured: Number of additional tree pests and diseases becoming established within a rolling 10-year period
notes:
Data are presented in rolling 10-year time periods.
    
</br>Data for 2002 to 2011 and 2003 to 2012 were revised in an earlier update of this indicator.

columns.schema:description: The year range for the data present

columns.schema:description: Number of additional tree pests and diseases becoming established in England within a rolling 10-year period
